items.title: NOURISH THE BODY
items.content: Do take a high protein diet with adequate milk and milk products. A balanced diet is very essential to ensure there is no weight gain.

items.title: DOCTOR'S APPOINTMENT
items.content: Do get a dental check up to prevent dental infections. Do regular and timely check-ups with your physician.

items.title: QUIT SMOKING
items.content: The first trimester is the most important time of pregnancy since it is during this time that the baby's reproductive organs develop, so don't get sick, don't smoke or drink because the baby could become abnormal, and the mother's weight and blood pressure will be monitored.

items.title: DETROY BAD HABITS
items.content: In the second trimester, keep going to your regular appointments, where we can utilize ultrasound to assess the baby's position and see whether there is a lack of weight or nutrition in the body. Eat well in order for your baby to be healthy.

items.title: EAT SMART
items.content: Do eat the rainbow. Not literally, but when you are meal-planning or find yourself in need of a snack, try to eat foods that are colorful: like carrots, apple, bananas.

items.title: GET ADVICE
items.content: The third trimester, or overall, is all about the mother's health. She should not eat too much, maintain a healthy weight, and have a routine check to see what diseases she had in her teenage years.

items.title: MATCH BABY STUFF
items.content: Prepare bags and other stuff that's needed during labor.
